instance_template: person(X). male(X). female(X). parent(X, Y). married(X, Y).

hard_constraints.description: Marriage is a two-way street. If A is married to B, B is married to A. Standard sanity check for relationships.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: married(Bride, Groom) :- married(Groom, Bride), Bride != Groom.

hard_constraints.description: Siblings are just kids with the same parent. But they gotta be different people, obviously.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: sibling(Child1, Child2) :- parent(Parent, Child1), parent(Parent, Child2), Child1 != Child2.

hard_constraints.description: The 'spouse becomes parent' rule. If you're married to a parent, you're officially a parent too. No escaping the kids.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: parent(Stepparent, Child) :- parent(Parent, Child), married(Parent, Stepparent).

hard_constraints.description: Uncles are just your parent's brothers. Male sibling logic, pretty straightforward.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: uncle(Uncle, Child) :- sibling(Parent, Uncle), parent(Parent, Child), male(Uncle).

hard_constraints.description: Grandparents are the parents of parents. Standard recursive jump.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: grandparent(Grandparent, Child) :- parent(Grandparent, Parent), parent(Parent, Child).

hard_constraints.description: The 'I'm my own grandpa' detector. If a guy is his own grandparent, we've hit the paradox.
